value.title: Different ways to work with Microsoft Excel in Power BI (2023)
value.excerpt: Using Excel? Of course, you are! How can you take advantage of Power BI? Adam shows you the different ways you can leverage Excel with Power BI to get the most out of it!  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level?

value.title: Help your Power BI report users with an Information Panel

Adam walks you through how to do it in Power BI Desktop!  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Create a Table in Power BI using Enter Data and How to Edit it
value.excerpt: Sometimes you just need a new table with a few rows or columns to be added to your data model. One option to create that table is to use the Enter Data option in Power BI Desktop. In this article, I’ll explain how you can use it, and also; more important: How to edit the data of that table after creating

value.title: Lakehouse VS  Warehouse VS  Datamart   The Difference Between The Three Fabric Objects
value.excerpt: Three types of objects in the Microsoft Fabric have similarities in what they can do for an analytics system. These three are; Lakehouse, Data Warehouse, and Power BI Datamart. All three objects provide storage for the data, which can be loaded into them using an ETL process and read using something

value.title: The Power BI Gateway   All You Need to Know
value.excerpt: Power BI is a data analysis tool that connects to many data sources. Suppose the data source for Power BI is located in an on-premises location. In that case, the connection from the cloud-based Power BI Service to the on-premises located data source should be created with an application called Gateway.

value.title: Using the SELECTEDVALUE function in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how the SELECTEDVALUE DAX function simplifies the syntax required in many scenarios where you need to read a single value selected in the filter context.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/53917?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.
